column4: Hya... I'm completley new to ubuntu and I just installed a nvidia driver through automatix2. I rebooted and it took a dump on me, the only thing that comes up after boot is a corrupted grey screen.
looks like #automatix is dead :(
I guess my real question is how to boot into a safe-mode of sorts
no necessarily, but automatix is known to blindly install packages to the machine, even there is an error.
try booting into single mode, can you ?
how do I do that?
if you can here the login sound meaning your system is not really screwed up I supposed, perhaps an X issue.
while configuring xserver, try to use the standard driver and uncheck 'dri' and 'glx' modules.
I don't know how to get to the xserver window... I'm going to try what LjL said real quick, thanks tho
hold on
to boot into single mode, on the GRUB menu, edit the line begins with /initrd (by pressing 'e') then append 'single'
however, by default Ubuntu includes a 'recovery mode', you can just choose it.
so just hit ESC on boot?
when booting into single user mode......
ok, thanks
...you'll be welcomed with a text login screen, after logging in type 'sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg'
if you just pressed Enter then the configuration file wouldn't change a bit. You should try changing the driver to a standard driver ('ati' or 'nv')
Ooh, I did read each prompt and answer accordingly, but I didn't realize nv is diffrent from nvidia
will do, thank you for the help. One sec
'nvidia' or 'fglrx' are for Nvidia 3D driver and ATI, respectively, that would be some hope.
yepp. I'll also try to leave automatix alone now :p
just be aware that you wouldn't get 3D support for that driver though.
Oh, so does that mean I can't run XGL?
probably, I'm not sure about xgl, but the nvidia driver is known to be unstable for me.
